svcsubsecinfo.para: It is very important that the frame be inspected periodically for cracks, buckling, crossmember loosening or other damage that may cause eventual failure of the frame. Additional inspections should be made whenever the chassis has been overloaded or involved in an accident. An alignment check is not sufficient since local cracks, crossmember loosening or sidemember buckling will not necessarily cause misalignment.

On reinforced sidemember sections, when cracks exist in either of the sidemember sections, the members must be separated for repair. After separation follow the procedures for non-reinforced sections. The two sidemember sections must not be welded together. After the weld repairs, the sections should be reinforced with the appropriate section and re-assembled with mounting bolts tightened to SAE Grade 8 torque levels.

svcproc.title: DRILLING OR NOTCHING
svcproc.para: Sidemembers should not be drilled or notched without approval from International Engineering. The maximum allowable sidemember hole size in the unrestricted zones shown in Figure 12 (located in the DRILLING section of this service section) is 11/16 inch (17 mm).
